tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE chord_progressions (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  name VARCHAR(255),
  progression TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE emotional_effects (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  effect_name VARCHAR(255),
  description TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE progressions_effects (
  progression_id INT,
  effect_id INT,
  FOREIGN KEY (progression_id) REFERENCES chord_progressions(id),
  FOREIGN KEY (effect_id) REFERENCES emotional_effects(id)
)

CREATE TABLE Chords (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    chord_name VARCHAR(50),
    root_note VARCHAR(10),
    chord_type VARCHAR(20),
    musical_key VARCHAR(10),
    emotion_effect VARCHAR(100)
);

CREATE TABLE ChordEmotionMapping (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    chord_id INT,
    emotion_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (chord_id) REFERENCES Chords(id),
    FOREIGN KEY (emotion_id) REFERENCES Emotions(id)
);

CREATE TABLE Chords (
  chord_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  chord_name VARCHAR(255),
  root_note VARCHAR(10),
  chord_type VARCHAR(20),
  description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE EmotionalEffects (
  effect_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  effect_name VARCHAR(255),
  positive BOOLEAN,
  intensity INTEGER,
  description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE ProgressionEffects (
  progression_effect_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  progression_id UUID,
  effect_id UUID,
  impact FLOAT,
  FOREIGN KEY (progression_id) REFERENCES Progressions (progression_id),
  FOREIGN KEY (effect_id) REFERENCES EmotionalEffects (effect_id)
);

CREATE TABLE ChordProgressions (
  cp_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  chord_id UUID,
  progression_id UUID,
  FOREIGN KEY (chord_id) REFERENCES Chords (chord_id),
  FOREIGN KEY (progression_id) REFERENCES Progressions (progression_id)
);
